title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Macy's has opted against separating its e-commerce business from its bricks-and-mortar stores amid calls from activist investor Jana to increase shareholder returns.

VW said it is in advanced talks with its largest shareholder, Porsche Automobil Holding SE, that could lead to an IPO of Porsche AG.

Home-price growth in the U.S. surged 18.8% in 2021, as low mortgage rates prompted buyers to compete fiercely for a limited number of homes for sale.

Home Depot said sales growth will likely slow this year, as it posted an 11% rise in quarterly revenue.

Meta ramped up its counterattack against TikTok by launching Reels for all global Facebook users and introducing many new features for advertisers.

Hedge fund Standard General said it struck a deal valued at $5.4 billion to buy TV broadcaster Tegna.

The U.S. urged Canada to abandon a plan to impose a digital service tax on large businesses.

What's News: Business & Finance
